doc.after: There is evidence to suggest that psychoactive mushrooms have been used by humans in religious ceremonies for thousands of years Murals dated 9000 to 7000 BCE found in the Sahara desert in southeast Algeria depict horned beings dressed as dancers clothed in garb decorated with geometrical designs and holding mushroom like objects Parallel lines extend from the mushroom shapes to the center of the dancers heads 5 6 000 year old pictographs discovered near the Spanish town of Villar del Humo illustrate several mushrooms that have been tentatively identified as Psilocybe hispanica a hallucinogenic species native to the area 6
